title: Disney Parks Animatronics, Rated Yearbook-Style
description: Walt Disney recently joined Imagineering's animatronic class to honor Disney's 70th anniversary‚Äîso we're handing out superlatives to the other standout robots.
author: Sabina Graves
excerpt: Walt Disney recently joined Imagineering's animatronic class to honor Disney's 70th anniversary‚Äîso we're handing out superlatives to the other standout robots.
text: Walt Disney is just the latest animatronic to be featured in Disney Parks‚Äô experiences and attractions. The figure debuted for Disneyland‚Äôs 70th birthday at the Main Street Opera House, headlining a new show. In Walt Disney ‚Äì A Magical Life, you can come face-to-face with the man behind the name, programmed to present his history as Imagineering‚Äôs latest tech feat. The figure joins the legacy of Disney‚Äôs contribution to theme park advancements, combining animation and robotics for his animatronics, which started with a bird and now bears the face of its creator. And he‚Äôs not the only memorable animatronic to grace Disney Parks with his presence. Here are some other notable entries, with yearbook-style superlatives to explain the impressions they make. Most likely to get into trouble: Hondo Onaka in Millennium Falcon: Smugglers Run He‚Äôs always getting unsuspecting tourists to do coaxium runs for him on the Millennium Falcon. If you‚Äôre not careful, you‚Äôll land on the First Order‚Äôs suspect list. And unfortunately, if that happens, Hondo might be MIA, just as his animatronic so often is. Most likely to ghost you: the 999 ghosts in The Haunted Mansion ¬© Disney Experiences And only after they try to follow you home first, like the Hitchhiking Ghosts. Sassiest: Indiana Jones in Indiana Jones Adventure Dr. Jones spends the entire ride complaining that he has to save our skins; it‚Äôs glorious. Plus he‚Äôs the original stuntronic, always having to dangle in front of that incoming boulder. Best Makeover: Ariel in Ariel‚Äôs Undersea Adventure¬† ¬© Disney Experiences The lore behind her soft-serve-ice-cream-looking hair of yesteryear haunts the internet; we‚Äôre glad she was able to get her look fixed. Best Dressed: Everyone in Tiana‚Äôs Bayou Adventure Seeing Tiana in her mother‚Äôs fashions and iconic 1920s New Orleans textiles and textures makes this our pick for best dressed. That goes for the rest of the characters too, especially once the ride gets to its showstopping finale. Class Clown: Figment the Dragon from Journey Into Imagination with Figment That Figment, always up to some nonsense, but at least he‚Äôs full of imagination and lots of surprising sights and smells to discover. The Cutest: Grogu in Galaxy‚Äôs Edge ¬© Disney Experiences It‚Äôs no contest; being able to meet and greet an interactive Baby Yoda who makes the noises makes us want to protect him at all costs too. Most likely to succeed: The children of the world in It‚Äôs a Small World Yeah‚Äîmore like succeeding in leading the animatronic uprising for having to sing that earworm of a song for 70 years. Most underrated: Captain Barbossa in Pirates of the Caribbean ¬© Disney Experiences Geoffrey Rush‚Äôs iconic performance as Captain Barbossa also got its own animatronic inside Disneyland‚Äôs Pirates of the Caribbean and fits right in so well, many don‚Äôt realize he‚Äôs being featured. The real pirate‚Äôs pirate, our apple-a-day king‚Äîhe‚Äôs just missing the monkey, Jack. The most scarily expressive: The Shaman from Avatar in Pandora‚Äôs Na‚Äôvi River Journey That‚Äôs one very realistic animatronic. And like in the Avatar movies, it sees you. The most chatty: The birds inside the Enchanted Tiki Room ¬© Disney Experiences They‚Äôre the OG blueprint of the animatronics, so we‚Äôll allow it for another 70 years at least. The most athletic: Spider-Man Stuntronic at Avengers Campus Spidey does the flips in one of the most thrilling moments at Avengers Campus, where the ‚Äústruntronic‚Äù flies through the sky before an actor takes over the performance! Even more excitingly, sometimes the robot webslinger misses. The GOAT: The Disneyland Goat on Big Thunder Mountain Railroad Not only is it still proudly perched in its spot, it provides the distraction to make the coaster all the more thrilling. Never forget to look at the goat and lock in. Want more io9 news? Check out when to expect the latest Marvel, Star Wars, and Star Trek releases, what‚Äôs next for the DC Universe on film and TV, and everything you need to know about the future of Doctor Who.
html:
Walt Disney is just the latest animatronic to be featured in Disney Parks‚Äô experiences and attractions. The figure debuted for Disneyland‚Äôs 70th birthday at the Main Street Opera House, headlining a new show.

In Walt Disney ‚Äì A Magical Life, you can come face-to-face with the man behind the name, programmed to present his history as Imagineering‚Äôs latest tech feat. The figure joins the legacy of Disney‚Äôs contribution to theme park advancements, combining animation and robotics for his animatronics, which started with a bird and now bears the face of its creator.

And he‚Äôs not the only memorable animatronic to grace Disney Parks with his presence. Here are some other notable entries, with yearbook-style superlatives to explain the impressions they make.

Most likely to get into trouble: Hondo Onaka in Millennium Falcon: Smugglers Run

He‚Äôs always getting unsuspecting tourists to do coaxium runs for him on the Millennium Falcon. If you‚Äôre not careful, you‚Äôll land on the First Order‚Äôs suspect list. And unfortunately, if that happens, Hondo might be MIA, just as his animatronic so often is.

Most likely to ghost you: the 999 ghosts in The Haunted Mansion

And only after they try to follow you home first, like the Hitchhiking Ghosts.

Sassiest: Indiana Jones in Indiana Jones Adventure

Dr. Jones spends the entire ride complaining that he has to save our skins; it‚Äôs glorious. Plus he‚Äôs the original stuntronic, always having to dangle in front of that incoming boulder.

Best Makeover: Ariel in Ariel‚Äôs Undersea Adventure¬†

The lore behind her soft-serve-ice-cream-looking hair of yesteryear haunts the internet; we‚Äôre glad she was able to get her look fixed.

Best Dressed: Everyone in Tiana‚Äôs Bayou Adventure

Seeing Tiana in her mother‚Äôs fashions and iconic 1920s New Orleans textiles and textures makes this our pick for best dressed. That goes for the rest of the characters too, especially once the ride gets to its showstopping finale.

Class Clown: Figment the Dragon from Journey Into Imagination with Figment

That Figment, always up to some nonsense, but at least he‚Äôs full of imagination and lots of surprising sights and smells to discover.

The Cutest: Grogu in Galaxy‚Äôs Edge

It‚Äôs no contest; being able to meet and greet an interactive Baby Yoda who makes the noises makes us want to protect him at all costs too.

Most likely to succeed: The children of the world in It‚Äôs a Small World

Yeah‚Äîmore like succeeding in leading the animatronic uprising for having to sing that earworm of a song for 70 years.

Most underrated: Captain Barbossa in Pirates of the Caribbean

Geoffrey Rush‚Äôs iconic performance as Captain Barbossa also got its own animatronic inside Disneyland‚Äôs Pirates of the Caribbean and fits right in so well, many don‚Äôt realize he‚Äôs being featured. The real pirate‚Äôs pirate, our apple-a-day king‚Äîhe‚Äôs just missing the monkey, Jack.

The most scarily expressive: The Shaman from Avatar in Pandora‚Äôs Na‚Äôvi River Journey

That‚Äôs one very realistic animatronic. And like in the Avatar movies, it sees you.

The most chatty: The birds inside the Enchanted Tiki Room

They‚Äôre the OG blueprint of the animatronics, so we‚Äôll allow it for another 70 years at least.

The most athletic: Spider-Man Stuntronic at Avengers Campus

Spidey does the flips in one of the most thrilling moments at Avengers Campus, where the ‚Äústruntronic‚Äù flies through the sky before an actor takes over the performance! Even more excitingly, sometimes the robot webslinger misses.

The GOAT: The Disneyland Goat on Big Thunder Mountain Railroad

Not only is it still proudly perched in its spot, it provides the distraction to make the coaster all the more thrilling. Never forget to look at the goat and lock in.

Want more io9 news? Check out when to expect the latest Marvel, Star Wars, and Star Trek releases, what‚Äôs next for the DC Universe on film and TV, and everything you need to know about the future of Doctor Who.
